grammar_rules.description: English has 12 main tenses for expressing time
examples: Present Continuous: I am studying English
Past Continuous: I was studying English
Future Simple: I will study English
Present Perfect: I have studied English

grammar_rules.description: English uses articles (a, an, the) before nouns
examples: An apple (indefinite, starts with vowel sound)

grammar_rules.description: Subjects and verbs must agree in number

examples: She has extensive knowledge of history

understand.meaning: to comprehend or grasp the meaning
examples: Do you understand what I mean?

hello.usage: General greeting for any time of day

common_errors.correct: Match subject and verb in number
common_errors.example: Wrong: 'He go to school' → Correct: 'He goes to school'
Wrong: 'I have book' → Correct: 'I have a book'

common_errors.correct: Use appropriate tense for time reference
common_errors.example: Wrong: 'Yesterday I go' → Correct: 'Yesterday I went'
Wrong: 'I book read' → Correct: 'I read a book'

cultural_context: English is a global language spoken by over 1.5 billion people
It's the primary language of international business and academia
English has many varieties (British, American, Australian, etc.)
Politeness and formality levels are important in English communication
